content.webTitle: Tommy Sheridan's wife 'feared for baby's life'

fields.headline: Tommy Sheridan's wife 'feared for baby's life'
fields.bodyText: Gail Sheridan, wife of the Scottish politician who won substantial damages last week over claims he indulged in orgies, revealed last night that she feared the stress of the allegations would cost her their unborn child. She spoke out as police confirmed they were investigating a complaint of perjury following Tommy Sheridan's victory in a libel trial against the News of the World, after questions were raised over the credibility of witnesses. Last night Mrs Sheridan said she had been pregnant with their daughter when the story emerged. She suffered abdominal pains and was rushed to hospital for tests. 'I feared for the life of my wife and unborn baby,' Mr Sheridan told the Mail on Sunday Mr Sheridan now plans to challenge again for the leadership of the Scottish Socialist Party.
